intro: Cyclosorus sulfureus, commonly known as the sulfur moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. The plant has a simple structure with a thalloid body that lacks true roots, stems, or leaves. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are small and inconspicuous, producing spores that are dispersed by wind. Cyclosorus sulfureus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
